intro: Argostemma acuminatum, commonly known as the narrow-pointed argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and numerous stamens. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
